page.title: 07Children and their bicycles
page.content: The cycle proficiency test is a test to help children learn road safety. The test is done in school. A policeman, P.C.Burns, comes into school to teach road safety to the third year children. It is taken each year. The children take the test so that they can ride their bicycles on the road. They are taught how to turn left and right. They learn where to ride on the road. They also learn how to do hand signals, that they should not ride in the middle of the road, and that they should not do wheelies. It is important to keep bicycles clean and to check the brakes, the chain, and the wheel nuts. This year nine children were successful in the test.
